intro: Houstonia tenuifolia f. leucantha, commonly known as the white bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. This variety is distinguished by its pale coloration compared to the typical blue flowers of the species.
